title: Analog Microelectronic Circuits 2021
desc: Since the world is analog, each interface between the world and a computer will contain analog circuits. In this course, an attempt is made to make a balance between theory and practice so that the discussed circuits can be constructed in the laboratory class or simulated with a software. The laboratory classes will help to build a strong foundation on the concepts. The other important feature of this course is, it covers circuits based on both BJT and MOSFET.

content.title: Unit 0 Lecture 1 Motivation to study electronic circuits
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the definition of engineering and motivation behind the study of circuits.

content.title: Unit 0 Lecture 2 Preliminaries
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the preliminaries for the study of electronic circuits.

content.title: Unit 0 Lecture 3 Elements and Elementary connections
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers elements and their connections, series and parallel.

content.title: Unit 0 Lecture 4 Controlled sources
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the theory of controlled sources.

content.title: Unit 1 Lecture 1 MOSFET Structure
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the structure of MOSFET.

content.title: Unit 1 Lecture 2 MOSFET Operation
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the operation of MOSFET.

content.title: Unit 1 Lecture 3 MOSFET - CV characteristics
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the Current Voltage Characteristics of a MOSFET.

content.title: Unit 1 Lecture 4 MOSFET Drain Current Equation
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the drain current equation of a MOSFET, graphical method.

content.title: Unit 1 Lecture 5 Channel Length Modulation
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers non idealities of a MOSFET.

content.title: Unit 1 Lecture 6 DC Numericals
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the numericals based on biasing circuits.

content.title: Unit 1 Lecture 7 DC Numericals
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the numericals based on biasing circuits.

content.title: Unit 1 Lecture 8 Models for Analog Design
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers small signal modelling of a MOSFET for analog design.

content.title: Unit 1 Lecture 9 MOSFET Amplifier configurations, CS Amplifier
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers 3 different amplifier configurations and CS amplifier in detail.

content.title: Unit 1 Lecture 10 MOSFET Intrinsic gain and Numerical
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers maximum gain of a MOSFET and numericals based on circuits.

content.title: Unit 1 Lecture 11 Numericals, Small Signal output resistance calculation
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers small signal output resistance of various MOSFET configurations.

content.title: Unit 1 Lecture 12 Small signal output resistance calculation
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers small signal output resistance of various MOSFET configurations.

content.title: Unit 1 Lecture 13 CS Amplifier with source degeneration
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the concept of source degeneration in a CS amplifier.

content.title: Unit 1 Lecture 14 CD and CG Amplifier - Summary
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers CD and CG amplifier - voltage gain, impedances.

content.title: Unit 2 Lecture 1 BJT - Structure, Modes of operation, DC problems
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the basic structure, modes of operation and basic dc problems of Bipolar Junction Transistor.

content.title: Unit 2 Lecture 2 BJT Operation, Current Equations
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the basic operation and the terminal crrent equations and other relations of BJT.

content.title: Unit 2 Lecture 3 BJT Large signal model, Small signal parameters

content.title: Unit 2 Lecture 4 Small Signal Models of BJT Part 1
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the ideal MOSFET models of CE configuration.

content.title: Unit 2 Lecture 4 Small Signal Models of BJT Part 2
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers re model of BJT.

content.title: Unit 2 Lecture 5 DC Numericals on BJT
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the numericals on the concept of biasing and amplifiers.

content.title: Unit 2 Lecture 6 BJT DC problems, Early Effect, Demo in multisim
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers numericals and demo of early effect in BJT.

content.title: Unit 2 Lecture 7 Small Signal Input and Output impedance of BJT
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the concept of calculation of small signal input and output impedance of BJT.

content.title: Unit 2 Lecture 8 BJT Intrinsic Gain, CE Amplifier
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the concept of intrinsic gain of BJT, Amplifier in CE configuration.

content.title: Unit 2 Lecture 9 CC Amplifier
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the concept of voltage buffer / CC amplifier.

content.title: Unit 2 Lecture 10 CE Amplifier with emitter degeneration
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the concept of emitter degeneration in a CE amplifier.

content.title: Unit 2 Lecture 11 Numericals
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the numericals on the concepts of amplifier.

content.title: Unit 2 Lecture 12 Numericals
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the numericals on the concepts of amplifier.

content.title: Unit 2 Lecture 13 Numericals
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the numericals on the concepts of amplifier.

content.title: Unit 2 Lecture 14 Numericals
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the numericals on the concepts of amplifier.

content.title: Unit 2 Lecture 15 Darlington Pair
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the concept of cascade of two CC configurations.

content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the Rout calculation of Wilson current mirror.

content.title: Unit 3 Lecture 12 Widlar Current Source

content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the numericals.

content.title: Unit 3 Lecture 14 Tutorial 3 Current mirrors
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the numericals.

content.title: Unit 4 Lecture 1 Introduction to Operational Amplifiers
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the ideal characteristics of opamp, differential and common mode signals.

content.title: Unit 4 Lecture 2 Operational Amplifiers - Inverting amplifier, Effect of finite open loop gain
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the circuit of opamp, inverting amp configuration, effect of finite open loop gain.

content.title: Unit 4  Lecture 9 Schmitt Trigger
